skill.name: internal-comms
skill.description: A set of resources to help me write all kinds of internal communications, using the formats that my company likes to use. Claude should use this skill whenever asked to write some sort of internal communications (status reports, leadership updates, 3P updates, company newsletters, FAQs, incident reports, project updates, etc.).
skill.summary: A set of resources to help me write all kinds of internal communications, using the formats that my ...

security_audit.summary: Official skill from Anthropic with documentation-only content. No executable code or external integrations found. Safe to publish.

content.value_statement: You need clear internal updates that match company formats. This skill guides you to draft newsletters, 3P updates, and FAQs quickly.
actual_capabilities: Formats 3P updates with Progress, Plans, and Problems sections
Structures company newsletters into sections with bullet points
Drafts FAQ questions and short answers for company-wide topics
Prompts for team name, dates, audience, tone, and purpose when missing
Applies concise, executive-friendly tone for internal updates
limitations: Does not access Slack, email, or documents without user-provided inputs
3P and FAQ formats are fixed and may not fit custom templates
Focuses on internal communications, not external or marketing copy

use_cases.title: Weekly 3P update
use_cases.description: Summarize weekly progress, plans, and blockers for leadership in a strict 3P format.

use_cases.title: Company newsletter
use_cases.description: Compile a concise company newsletter with sections and bullet points for a large audience.

use_cases.title: Company FAQ roundup
use_cases.description: Produce a set of common employee questions with short, official answers and source links.

prompt_templates.title: Basic 3P update
prompt_templates.prompt: Write a 3P update for the Mobile team covering Aug 5 to Aug 11. Progress: shipped v2 onboarding. Plans: beta Android. Problems: QA staffing.

prompt_templates.title: Newsletter draft
prompt_templates.prompt: Draft a company newsletter for September with sections for leadership updates, product progress, and recruiting. Use short bullet points and we voice.

prompt_templates.title: FAQ responses
prompt_templates.prompt: Create FAQs about the new remote work policy and the upcoming product launch. Provide one sentence question and two sentence answer.

prompt_templates.title: General comms
prompt_templates.prompt: Write a concise internal message about a planned database migration. Audience is all engineers. Tone is informative and urgent.

output_examples.input: Create a 3P update for the Data team for last week.
output: Progress: Shipped pipeline monitoring and reduced data delays by 20 percent.
Plans: Roll out new schema validation and expand metrics coverage.
Problems: Two open incidents awaiting vendor fixes.

best_practices: Provide dates, audience, and team name for accurate formatting
Share key metrics and milestones for concise, data-driven updates
Link to authoritative sources when summarizing company news
anti_patterns: Using the newsletter format for small team updates
Skipping clarification when audience or tone is unclear
Adding long narrative paragraphs instead of concise bullets

faq.question: Is this skill compatible with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code?
faq.answer: Yes. It is a text-based skill and works on all three platforms.

faq.question: What limits should I expect?
faq.answer: It only formats content you provide and does not fetch data from tools.

faq.question: Can it integrate with Slack or Google Drive?
faq.answer: Not directly. Provide summaries or links from those sources in your prompt.

faq.question: How is my data handled?
faq.answer: The skill only uses the text you provide and does not store data.

faq.question: What if the format does not match my needs?
faq.answer: Use the general comms prompt and specify your required structure.

faq.question: How does it compare to generic writing prompts?
faq.answer: It enforces specific internal formats like 3P updates and company newsletters.
